revised_title: Effect of Anions on the Duration of the Active State in Skeletal Muscle
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand the effects of nitrate, iodide, and bromide on the duration of the active state in skeletal muscle. They found that these anions increase the duration of the active state after a shock, leading to increased tension and heat production in a twitch. The results suggest that the duration of the active state is determined by a process happening at the surface of the muscle fibers, rather than being an intrinsic property of the contractile mechanism.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
